p: M. pneumoniae is the most thoroughly studied human pathogenic mycoplasma concerning glycerol metabolism. M. pneumoniae generates H 2O 2 during the metabolism of glycerol by GlpD and GlpQ [ 9, 17, 198]. The formation of H 2O 2 is essential to the cytotoxicity of M. pneumoniae and can cause host cell damage, peroxidation of lipids, and oxidation of heme, rather than the lysis of erythrocytes [ 8, 9, 17]. Moreover, M. homins can also produce H 2O 2 via GlpO [ 191].
